meanings.definition: To keep in the same position; to maintain
meanings.sent1: She stets the picture on the wall to make sure it doesn't fall.
meanings.sent2: He stets his promise to always be there for his friends.
meanings.sent3: The cat stets its gaze on the bird outside the window.
meanings.sent4: Her determination stets her on the path to success.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse stets its light to guide ships safely to shore.

meanings.definition: To keep unchanged; to stand firm
meanings.sent1: The old tree stets its place in the forest for decades.
meanings.sent2: The principles of honesty and integrity stets despite challenges.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn mule stets its refusal to move from the spot.
meanings.sent4: His beliefs stets like a rock in the face of opposition.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins stets as a reminder of a bygone era.
